data.title: Doctor Who: Here’s the list of all Doctors and actors playing the character
data.meta_description: Explore the complete chronological list of Doctor Who's incarnations and the actors who portrayed them, from the First Doctor in 1963 to the latest, the Fifteenth Doctor.
data.text:
Synopsis

Explore the complete chronological list of Doctor Who's incarnations and the actors who portrayed them, from the First Doctor in 1963 to the latest, the Fifteenth Doctor.

Doctor Who, the longest-running sci-fi series, introduced a unique concept of regeneration, allowing various actors to embody the iconic Time Lord character since its debut in 1963.

First Doctor: William Hartnell (1963 – 1966)

William Hartnell initiated the series, portraying an initially stern First Doctor, later evolving into a friendly figure during his three-year tenure.

Second Doctor: Patrick Troughton (1966 – 1969)

After a renewal caused by battling the Cybermen, Patrick Troughton's Second Doctor showcased a scruffier, childlike persona, maintaining the show's longevity.

Third Doctor: Jon Pertwee (1970 – 1974)

Jon Pertwee's Third Doctor marked a narrative shift, exiled on Earth and working for UNIT, introducing a more technologically oriented Time Lord.

Fourth Doctor: Tom Baker (1974 – 1981)

Tom Baker's iconic portrayal of the Fourth Doctor, with eccentricity and charm, spanned seven series, making him a beloved figure among fans.

Fifth Doctor: Peter Davison (1982 – 1984)

Peter Davison's Fifth Doctor, known for his Edwardian cricketer outfit, showcased a well-mannered and helpful persona with a knack for seeing the good in people.

Sixth Doctor: Colin Baker (1984 – 1986)

Colin Baker's brash and arrogant Sixth Doctor, distinguished by vibrant attire, traveled with only two companions during his three-series run.

Valeyard: Michael Jayston (1986)

The Valeyard, portrayed by Michael Jayston, appeared in 1986, representing The Doctor's darker side and seeking to steal The Sixth Doctor's regenerations.

Seventh Doctor: Sylvester McCoy (1987 – 1989)

Sylvester McCoy's Seventh Doctor, initially whimsical, evolved into a master manipulator with a darker nature, accompanied by two companions.

Eighth Doctor: Paul McGann (1996)

Paul McGann's Eighth Doctor appeared in the 1996 TV film, bringing charm and enthusiasm, although the attempt to relaunch the series was not successful.

Ninth Doctor: Christopher Eccleston (2005)

Christopher Eccleston's portrayal of the Ninth Doctor in 2005 revived the series, presenting a less eccentric, traumatized Time Lord post-Time War.

Tenth Doctor: David Tennant (2005 – 2010)

David Tennant's Tenth Doctor, charming and charismatic, faced emotional challenges, protecting companions Rose, Martha and Donna.

Meta-Crisis Doctor: David Tennant (2008)

The Meta-Crisis Doctor emerged in 2008, sharing DNA with Donna Noble, offering a unique perspective on The Doctor's character.

Eleventh Doctor: Matt Smith (2010 – 2013)

Matt Smith's Eleventh Doctor, a youthful thrill-seeker, brought explosive energy, accompanied by companions Amy, Rory and Clara.

War Doctor: John Hurt (2013)

John Hurt's War Doctor played a crucial role in the Time War, uniting with Tenth and Eleventh incarnations to divert the destruction of Gallifrey.

Twelfth Doctor: Peter Capaldi (2014 – 2017)

Peter Capaldi's pragmatic Twelfth Doctor evolved from a stoic character to a kinder, compassionate figure, accompanied by Clara, Bill and Nardole.

Thirteenth Doctor: Jodie Whittaker (2018 – 2022)

Jodie Whittaker's Thirteenth Doctor, the first female incarnation, brought light-hearted warmth, exploring space and time with a diverse group of companions.

Fugitive Doctor: Jo Martin (2020 – 2022)

Jo Martin's Fugitive Doctor, a mysterious past incarnation, added intrigue, revealed during Jodie Whittaker's era and aiding against threats.

Fourteenth Doctor: David Tennant (2022 – 2023)

David Tennant returned as the Fourteenth Doctor for the 60th-anniversary specials, displaying vulnerability and reuniting with companions from past adventures.

Fifteenth Doctor: Ncuti Gatwa (2023 -)

Ncuti Gatwa, introduced in the 60th-anniversary special, embodies the energetic and caring Fifteenth Doctor, beginning a new adventure with companion Ruby Sunday.

With 19 actors portraying the iconic role in the series, Doctor Who continues to captivate audiences, offering fresh perspectives on the enigmatic Time Lord across the years.

FAQs:

How many actors have played The Doctor?

Nineteen actors have portrayed The Doctor. Though officially 15 numbered Doctors exist, alternative versions, including the Fugitive Doctor, result in a total of 19 incarnations in the TV show's history.

What distinguishes the Fourth Doctor, Tom Baker's portrayal?

Tom Baker's Fourth Doctor, spanning 1974 to 1981, was warm, whimsical, and iconic, known for eccentric speech, a signature hat, and scarf. His seven-series tenure makes him the longest-serving Doctor.
